title: On the border between Ukraine and Belarus, the 'relative calm' of a region under high surveillance
description: From the frontline, Ukrainian soldiers in high spirits maintain vigilance and keep a watchful eye out for Russian and Belarusian positions.

title: Lula kicks off European tour in Portugal at odds with Europe over Ukraine
description: In Lisbon, the Brazilian leader, seeking diplomatic ties with Europe, avoided feeding the controversy regarding his recent comments about Western military aid fueling Ukraine and Russia’s conflict.

title: Dakar: The new target for drug traffickers in West Africa
description: Placed on the new drug routes, the Senegalese capital is seeing a surge in local consumption. So much so that an addiction treatment center, the first of its kind in West Africa, opened there in 2015.

title: 'AI is freaking out the music and arts sectors'
description: Levi's decision to launch an advertising campaign with artificial intelligence-generated mannequins is typical of AI moving from being an assistant to being an actor in the game, writes Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: UK politics: Raab's resignation comes as a blow to Sunak's government
description: The departure of the deputy prime minister, prompted by the publication of an official report into bullying allegations, weakens the Tories.

title: Wanted: Temporary drug dealers and lookouts for quick cash
description: In Marseille and around Paris, a workforce often composed of vulnerable youth or recently arrived immigrants is being recruited through ads on Snapchat to serve as temporary, 'entry-level staff' for drug dealing networks.

title: French transport minister visits Ukraine to address infrastructure needs
description: In addition to military aid to Kyiv, the French government intends to provide civilian support for the maintenance and reconstruction of Ukraine's rail network and port facilities.

title: Abortion pill: US Supreme Court opts for status quo
description: The highest US court upheld access to chemical abortion on Friday but did not rule on the substance of the issue.

title: Australian comedian Barry Humphries dies, aged 89
description: The comedian, actor, author and satirist was best known for writing and playing his on-stage and television alter ego, Dame Edna Everage.

title: In the midst of the fighting, Sudanese citizens resist in solidarity
description: Volunteers have been helping civilians in distress and providing them with medicine as a war between two generals keeps raging. The fighting has already left 413 dead and more than 3,500 injured.

title: Why Americans are dying in their prime
description: Life expectancy in the United States stands at 76.1 years, the lowest since 1996. Guns, car accidents and opioids decimating young populations are the main reasons for this development, which is contrary to that of comparable countries.

title: Fearing Pyongyang missile, Japan puts military on alert
description: The North Korean regime said earlier this week it was ready to launch its first military spy satellite.

title: American activist Angela Davis becomes focus of controversy in Parisian high school
description: Asked by the Paris region chief to take sides over the name of a local high school, France's education minister sidestepped the issue and gave a history lesson.

title: Eric Garandeau, TikTok's cultural influence agent in France
description: The Chinese application has enlisted a financial inspector, an accomplished pianist who was a former adviser to Nicolas Sarkozy, to expand in France.

title: Animal suffering: 'We should tax or even ban animal products from farms that do not comply with minimum European standards'
description: Eight organizations are arguing for measures against the importation of animals raised at farms with no regard for social, ecological or animal welfare standards.

title: French protest against planned highway under high scrutiny, after reservoir clashes
description: Environmentalist activists hope to strengthen their mobilization against the highway project to link two cities in southern France during gatherings on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Lyft preparing to make 'signficant' layoffs under new leadership
description: Lyft will notify employees next week as to whether they still have jobs with the San Francisco-based company, which will keep all of its offices closed that day, new CEO David Risher said.

title: Swedish government ponders census to track down undocumented immigrants
description: Under the guise of correcting errors in the population registers, the right-wing and far-right government coalition is also thinking of carrying out identity checks in 'high-risk neighborhoods.'

title: Al-Qaeda affiliate claims responsibility for attack that killed chief of staff of Mali junta leader
description: Oumar Traore was among several people who died in an ambush Tuesday near the Mauritanian border.

title: Paris police accused of deliberately hitting children on scooters as families demand justice and truth
description: Three police officers suspected of deliberately running down three minors riding a scooter during a chase in Paris on April 13 have been taken into custody. The families' lawyer denounced 'extremely serious police violence.'

title: Covid-19: High-security lab construction is booming, three years after virus outbreak
description: An increased number of facilities studying the most dangerous pathogens requires constant and stricter surveillance, experts point out.

title: 'France and the European Union are more likely to undergo global geopolitical reconfiguration than to direct it'
description: In an article for 'Le Monde,' Thomas Gomart, the director of the French Institute of International Relations explains that while France is ahead of the EU in terms of rearmament, the Europe is behind other strategic actors.
